Vulkan Info

vulkaninfo is a program provided in the SDK which outputs various types of Vulkan information such as:

  • device properties of identified GPUs
  • Vulkan extensions supported by each GPU
  • recognized layers
  • supported image formats and format properties.

Running Vulkan Info

After downloading and installing the SDK and setting up the runtime environment (see the Getting Started documentation) you will be able to run the vulkaninfo program from a command prompt.

vulkaninfo

Running vulkaninfo without specifying the type of output will default to human-readable output to the console.

vulkaninfo --html

To organize output in a convenient HTML format use the --html flag. Running vulkaninfo with the --html option produces a file called vulkaninfo.html and can be found in your build directory.

vulkaninfo --json

Use the --json flag to produce DevSim-schema-compatible JSON output for your device. Additionally, JSON output can be specified with the -j flag and for multi-GPU systems, a single GPU can be targeted using the --json=GPU-number flag where the GPU-number indicates the GPU of interest (e.g., --json=0). To determine the GPU number corresponding to a particular GPU, run vulkaninfo with the --html flag (or none at all) first; doing so will summarize all GPUs in the system.

The generated configuration information can be used as input for the VK_LAYER_LUNARG_device_simulation layer.

Windows

vulkaninfo can also be found as a shortcut under the Start Menu.

  • Start Menu -> Vulkan SDKversion-> vulkaninfo

Note: In order to review and/or save the output produced when using Visual Studio to run vulkaninfo with the JSON option, you will have to redirect output to a file by modifying the command line arguments in the debug options.
